question_text.body: An IDE is able to show a user where syntax errors have been made in their code and explain the mistake that has been made. What is this feature called?

The editor in an IDE can assist the programmer by showing them available properties, functions or procedures as they type code. This saves typing and allows the programmer to see available options. What is this feature called?
Different parts of source code can be coloured differently by the editor in an IDE according to what their purpose is. What is this feature called?
Using which method will result in programs to run the slowest?
Which type of translator is this a description of? Translates low level assembly code into machine code
Which type of translator is this a description of? Translates high level source code into machine code
Which type of translator is this a description of? Executes one line at a time

An example of a high level language is Visual Basic
An example of a high level language is Python

Which of these does not use an IDE?
All programmers only use IDEs now.
IDEs can check the contents of any variable at any time.
IDEs are useful for programming complex solutions.
When debugging a program the user can add breakdots to pause the execution of the code at a certain point.
IDE is the abbreviation of integrated development environment.
Modern IDEs assist programmers by:

answers.text: Stopping any errors from being produced
Removing the need to write any code at all
